intro: Stachys germanica var. banatica, commonly known as Banat's hedge nettle, is a perennial herb native to Central and Eastern Europe. It features upright stems covered in fine, soft hairs and possesses opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces clusters of small, two-lipped, pinkish to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded to partially shaded environments, often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive member of the Lamiaceae family, known for its aromatic properties and ecological value.
